title: Harpreet Singh
text:
About
I am a data analyst with a strong background in the education sector, specializing in transforming complex data into actionable insights to support student success and institutional improvement. With hands-on experience in data visualization, reporting, and trend analysis, I help drive data-informed decision-making in educational environments.
My mission is “To harness the power of data to uncover opportunities, solve problems, and create measurable impact”.

title: 📄 Resume
text:

MBA, University Canada West (Expected 2025)
  Focus: Business Analytics
B.Sc. Computer Science, Guru Nanak Dev University, India (2009)
  Concentration: SQL, C++, DBMS



Society for Meritorious Schools – Data Analyst (2024)
  Conducted student performance research leading to a 10% improvement in student retention rate.
  Developed Tableau dashboards to assess comparative performance of institution leading to 6% improvement in admissions.
DIPS Group of Colleges - Data Analyst (2012–2015)
  Developed SQL data query for identifying key problematic areas in academics and improving institution ranking by 10 ranking.
  Implemented a staff leave application database project for efficient leave tracking and analysis, which decreased administrative workload by 15%..

title: Projects
text:
Here’s a selection of my data and analytics projects, with summaries and previews:
 ### Customer Journeys (Tableau Dashboard) Analyzed the marketing funnel to identify drop-offs between impressions, clicks, and purchases. Built an interactive Tableau dashboard to optimize conversion strategies.
View Project »
 ### Hospital KPIs Analysis Evaluated hospital operational performance using patient visits, drug administration data, and survey results. Highlighted trends in patient care quality, safety, and satisfaction.
View Project »
 ### Email Campaign Funnel Analysis
Assessed email engagement performance across categories, with CTR as a key KPI. Provided insights for targeted marketing strategies to improve retention and conversions.
View Project »
